bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: rpm -ql smuxi-engine | grep .exe /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-message-buffer.exe /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-message-buffer.exe.config /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-message-buffer.exe.mdb /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe.config
there is no real use for .exe files in fedora rpms. Please remove those files.
Version is 1.0.5.1.fc25
Additional info:

> there is no real use for .exe files in fedora rpms. Please remove those files.
Do you mean that smuxi works even without them?

file /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-message-buffer.exe /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-message-buffer.exe: PE32 executable (console) Intel 80386 Mono/.Net assembly, for MS Windows
/usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe bash: /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
It doesn't look like they are useful, no?
smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-d077dbc073
smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-77293905f3

smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-77293905f3

smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-d077dbc073
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.
smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
smuxi-1.0.6-3.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This proposed change must not have been tested, as it breaks Smuxi outright.
There is indeed a use for .exe files on Linux, they are used to run .NET applications with Mono, as is the case for Smuxi.
After this change: $ smuxi-server Cannot open assembly '/usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe': No such file or directory.
Because: $ cat /usr/bin/smuxi-server #!/bin/sh [...] exec mono --debug "/usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe" "$@"
And /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-server.exe is no longer provided by the RPM.
Please revert this! Thank you.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Chesterton%27s_fence

Had you looked closer, you would have also noticed: $ rpm -ql smuxi-engine | grep '.dll$' /usr/lib/smuxi/Db4objects.Db4o.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/JabbR.Client.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/Meebey.SmartIrc4net.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/Microsoft.AspNet.SignalR.Client.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/Newtonsoft.Json.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/ServiceStack.Common.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/ServiceStack.Interfaces.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/ServiceStack.Text.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/StarkSoftProxy.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/Twitterizer2.Streaming.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/Twitterizer2.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/agsxmpp.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-common.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine-campfire.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine-irc.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine-jabbr.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine-twitter.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine-xmpp.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-engine.dll /usr/lib/smuxi/smuxi-frontend.dll
Was this request part of some mass "remove all the .exe"s attempted-cleanup which broke other Mono-based software as well?

(In reply to Jean-Philippe Ouellet from comment #11)
> > Was this request part of some mass "remove all the .exe"s attempted-cleanup > which broke other Mono-based software as well?
No, it was not. I just found many .exe files on my local setup, some due to applications based on mono, some .exe files distributed by accident. It's up to the package maintainer to decide, if the bug report is valid or not.
